channel.title: Profanity Filter toggle
channel.description:
We’ve added a new feature to the old chat filter, now renamed as the profanity filter. Its default function is still to be turned on to filter out all the words (and URLs) on our blacklist, but we’ve added the option for you to turn the filter off. We recognise that RuneScape has a maturing player base and, as such, wish to give you the freedom to choose for yourselves, while also still keeping the filter for those players who do not wish to see swear words and the like.
About time! :)

item.title: Profanity Filter toggle
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Yeah. Well, I don’t think ‘sold’ so much as accepted sponsorship and advertisement deals, with the advertisements directly controlled by the Curse network.

Jagex wanted the deal so they could have direct control of the advertisements that appeared on Zybez, but they wanted to eat their cake as well.
The good news for Zybez though is that they’re practically a household name for Runescape players, and even if the name is filtered it won’t stop further growth.

Read full topic

item.title: Profanity Filter toggle
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:27, topic:381853”][quote author=BloodRayne link=topic=477663.msg3508930#msg3508930 date=1298403457]

I can’t believe they don’t filter ‘moparscape’, awesome!

Yet they still filter Zybez, why that is is beyond me XD
[/quote]
Out of jealousy and spite. Zybez sold out to another company who offered them a superior deal. Jagex couldn’t handle it, so now they’re all shitty about it.
It’s just like telling a child that they can’t have a chocolate at the shops, and the ensuing temper tantrum.
I could just imagine Andrew Gower stamping his foot on the ground being all angry and stuff saying ‘okay, that’s it, do your best to bury their website’.[/quote]

As in Jagex offered to buy Zybez but they sold to another company?

Read full topic

item.title: Profanity Filter toggle
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

I did some research on this new update. If you swear in frustration, you won’t get in trouble, but if you actually insult someone or are offensive towards them, it’s against the rules still and you will get in trouble for it. Also, players who have been previously punished are unaffected by this update and will remain muted, banned, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Profanity Filter toggle
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:20, topic:381853”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=477663.msg3506336#msg3506336 date=1298176085]

They still place overbearing constraints on external URLs, which kind of defeats the purpose in my opinion. Case in point would be zybez, which remains filtered even with the censor disabled.

On the bright side, I was able to walk into the wilderness on a desolate world and sing Blink 182’s song Family Reunion without any censorship stars.

If someone hasn’t already told you or you found out for yourself, they are working on creating a list of allowed URLs that will not be blocked from the game. It would probably include Zybez among many other RS help sites.
[/quote]

I wonder if moparisthebest.com or moparisthebest.com will be on that ‘allowed URLs’ list?[/quote]
Fat chance. XD

Read full topic

There you go Hans Brix! How you rike that, you fucking cocksucker! Do you have any idea how fucking busy I am Hans Brix? Well fuck you! You want inspection, well inspect that you butt-fucking piece of shit!

What, you think I’m just a petty arms dealer? I’m pranning the attack. Congratulations Team America, you have stopped nothing.

Haha, I love Team America.

item.title: Profanity Filter toggle
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:13, topic:381853”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=477663.msg3495380#msg3495380 date=1297285998]
Maybe they did it to combat the famous “hey everyone! runescape blocks your password when you type it see: *********** it works, try it!”?
[/quote]
cause that ‘scam’ ever actually worked[/quote]

One of the few memories I have left from actually playing runescape was being on a members world, someone saying that, and then someone actually trying it out with their password. I agree that ‘scam’ should never work, but apparently it did sometimes.

Read full topic

item.title: Profanity Filter toggle
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I wonder how they handle the reports though. They could send a flag with each report indicating whether the censor was active or not - but what happens if their censor is off, they witness profanity, and then enable it and report?
You’d hope that the jmod reviewing the evidence would notice this, but in my experience they’re a trigger-happy bunch.

Read full topic
